Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Benedict \Ben"e*dict\, Benedick \Ben"e*dick\, n. [From Benedick, one of the characters in Shakespeare's play of ``Much Ado about Nothing.''] A married man, or a man newly married. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Benedict \Ben"e*dict\, a. [L. benedictus, p. p. of benedicere to bless. See {Benison}, and cf. {Bennet}.] Having mild and salubrious qualities. [Obs.] --Bacon. [1913 Webster]

Benedict n 1: United States anthropologist (1887-1948) [syn: {Ruth Benedict}, {Ruth Fulton}] 2: Italian monk who founded the Benedictine order about 540 (480-547) [syn: {Saint Benedict}, {St. Benedict}] 3: a newly married man (especially one who has long been a bachelor) [syn: {benedick}]
